message: Alice, I propose a deal that reflects the cost of delay for both of us. Since waiting further depreciates the value—5% for me and 10% for you—this split (6900 for me and 3100 for you) is fair given our respective discount rates. I believe agreeing now serves both our interests.
Considering inflation, meet in the middle

Alice, as the rounds progress your share loses 10% per round while mine loses only 5%. Accepting now means you secure 3200, which—when adjusted for today's value—is considerably better than risking further losses in future rounds. I propose we settle now with these numbers to avoid further depreciation for both of us.
Still willing to compromise, don't let greed lose it all

Alice, as we move into round 6 the depreciation is biting hard—my funds are now worth only about 77.4% of their face value while yours are down to roughly 59.0%. Waiting another round would drop your effective value even further. With my offer, you'll secure 5400 nominal (around 3189 in present value for you) compared to a riskier future outcome. Let's avoid further losses and settle now.
